data.note: Argentina's credit-worthiness is low across all credit rating agencies. Cammesa and Enarsa are state-owned institutions and backed by the federal government. As a result, their credit worthiness is tied to the country itself. Ratings for private utilities are the following: for 2013 Edenor has low ratings: Moodys: Caa3, S&P: CCC-, Fitch: NR; Edesur only has ratings for before 2003, and Edelap has no ratings.
data.name: Power offtake risk for independent generators
